repos_url.name: utils.log.log_interface
repos_url.description: This package contains an interface used by many components to log messages. Please download a logger package that implements this interface (like the errorlog_logger package)

repos_url.name: html.html_element
repos_url.description: This package contains the HtmlElementInterface interface that can be used to output HTML on a page. It also features base classes implementing this interface.

repos_url.name: utils.log.errorlog_logger
repos_url.description: This package contains a logger that should be used to log messages directly to the PHP error log (using the error_log PHP function)

repos_url.name: utils.common.conditioninterface
repos_url.description: This package contains one interface for condition, and a few classes that implement it. A condition is a class that possesses an "isOk" method. The condition returns true if the condition is met, and false otherwise.

repos_url.name: html.widgets.statsgrid
repos_url.description: This PHP package contains a HTML pivot table. You provide it with a data set and the list of columns and rows and it will display a nice pivot table.

repos_url.name: html.utils.weblibrarymanager
repos_url.description: The Javascript/CSS library manager is a PHP class in charge of keeping track of the JS and CSS files that have been included so far in a web page. Basically, you tell the Javascript/CSS library manager to import a JS/CSS file and it will make sure it is included, only once, and that all dependencies are included as well.

repos_url.name: html.template.templateinterface
repos_url.description: This package contains the definition of an HTML template (the TemplateInterface interface) and an helper class to build HTML templates easily (the BaseTemplate class).

repos_url.name: html.template.mouftemplate
repos_url.description: This package contains a template for the Mouf administration interface. The content is automatically adjusted to the website page to use all the width. Anyway, you can use this component as a model if you like.

repos_url.name: utils.i18n.fine
repos_url.description: Fine is a PHP internationalisation package. It will help you provide applications that support several languages. FINE means: Fine is not english :). Translation is performed using PHP mapping files, but you will have a nice graphical interface in the Mouf framework to write your own translated messages.

repos_url.name: mvc.splash-common
repos_url.description: The Core part of Splash (an MVC framework). It is used by Splash itself, but also by Drusplash (the Splash wrapper for Drupal)

repos_url.name: mvc.splash
repos_url.description: A MVC framework deeply integrated with Mouf

repos_url.name: html.widgets.menu
repos_url.description: This PHP package contains objects describing a menu of an application. The menu is described, but this package does not render the menu in any way. You will have to use another package to render the menu in HTML. Usually, templates will provide their own menu renderers.

repos_url.name: javascript.jquery.jquery-ui
repos_url.description: This package contains the JQuery UI library, along a Mouf installer file to add JQuery UI easily in your Mouf project.

repos_url.name: javascript.underscore
repos_url.description: This package contains the Underscore javascript library, along a Mouf installer file to add Underscore easily in your Mouf project.

repos_url.name: javascript.jquery.jquery
repos_url.description: This package contains the JQuery library, along a PHP wrapper class to include JQuery easily in your web pages.

repos_url.name: javascript.jquery.jquery-filetree
repos_url.description: This package contains the JQuery FileTree component, along a PHP wrapper class to include JQuery FileTree easily in your web pages.

repos_url.name: javascript.syntaxhighlighter
repos_url.description: This package contains the SyntaxHighlighter javascript library, along a Mouf installer file to add SyntaxHighlighter easily in your Mouf project.

repos_url.name: html.template.menus.basicmenu
repos_url.description: This package contains a single class in charge of rendering a "Menu" instance in HTML using the toHtml() method. The rendering is performed using <ul> and <li> tags.

repos_url.name: html.template.menus.topribbonmenu
repos_url.description: This package contains a menu that is displayed as a ribbon at the top of the screen. The class is in charge of rendering a 'Menu' instance in HTML using the toHtml() method.

repos_url.name: security.rightsservice
repos_url.description: A set of class to manage the rights of users in web-application. You should use this package if you want to restrict access to some parts of your web-application to some users only (for instance if you want to make an 'admin' section that is only accessible to the adminsitrator).

repos_url.name: security.rightsservice-splash
repos_url.description: This package contains a set of class to bind the Splash MVC framework (>=v4) with the RightsService component. It features: a @RequiresRight annotation to restrict access to logged users only.

repos_url.name: security.simplelogincontroller
repos_url.description: This package contains a simple Splash controller to log into an application. The controller can display a simple form with username/password choice, and has actions to login/logout the application.

repos_url.name: security.userfiledao
repos_url.description: This package contains an implementation of a UserDao, that stores the application users in a simple PHP file. It can be used together with the MoufUserService to provide easy access management to an application. Since the users are stored in a PHP file, this very special DAO does not require a database!

repos_url.name: security.userservice
repos_url.description: A set of PHP class to manage log-in and log-out of web applications and that integrates with Mouf.

repos_url.name: security.userservice-splash
repos_url.description: This package contains a set of class to bind the Splash MVC framework (>=v4.0) with the UserService component. It features: a @Logged annotation to restrict access to logged users only.

repos_url.name: utils.cache.cache-interface
repos_url.description: This Mouf PHP package only contains the interface that must be implemented by caching classes. Unless you want to implement your own caching method, you should import a cache package that will use this interface. For instance, common.utils.session-cache, or common.utils.file-cache.

repos_url.name: utils.cache.apc-cache
repos_url.description: This package contains a cache mechanism that relies on the APC caching system. For this cache to work, the APC Pecl package must be enabled.

repos_url.name: utils.cache.file-cache
repos_url.description: This package contains a cache mechanism that relies on temporary files.

repos_url.name: utils.cache.memcache-cache
repos_url.description: This package contains a cache mechanism that relies on the Memcached database. For this cache to work, the memcache Pecl package must be enabled.

repos_url.name: utils.cache.memcached-cache
repos_url.description: This package contains a cache mechanism that relies on the Memcached database. For this cache to work, the memcached Pecl package must be enabled.

issue.title: [BUG]: Task :app:checkDebugAarMetadata FAILED
issue.body:
### react-native environment setup

- [X] I verified that I have not react-native-cli installed globally and be up to date about the React Native environment setup.

### Description

Hello guys,
When I try to `yarn android` or `npm run android`  I get error below:
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60744057/168300248-94ee4887-c5a5-43aa-a13d-5c1f8c113d45.PNG)
Also I didn't change anything in the boilerplate, just ran the app !
and one more thing, I found this amazing template just 2 hours ago :), so I use last version of this template and this is my package.json
[package.json.txt](https://github.com/thecodingmachine/react-native-boilerplate/files/8688456/package.json.txt)
 

### Version

3.3.0

### On which OS this issue appear on?

- [ ] IOS
- [X] Android

### Desktop OS

Windows 10

comment.body:
Ok 🫤 did you install your Java SE Development Kit (JDK)with the following cmd like in the documentation ?
```
choco install -y openjdk11
```

commits.message:
Merge pull request #2169 from thecodingmachine/develop

Release v1.10

Merge pull request #2193 from thecodingmachine/develop

Deploy 2022-05-11

Adding a check of the front/pusher version

When connecting, we will now verify that the pusher and the front
have a compatible API version.
If the front is not compatible with the pusher (because the pusher was updated and the front is still in the old version),
a message is displayed to propose updating to the new version.

The API version is actually a hash of the proto messages files + the Zod API files.
So if anything changes there, the users will have to reload their WorkAdventure.

Merge pull request #2195 from thecodingmachine/tag_api_version

Adding a check of the front/pusher version
remember to refresh gridRows count

Merge pull request #2198 from thecodingmachine/fix-select-character-grid-rows-count

remember to refresh gridRows count

Allowing "*" as a valid value for FRONT_URL in pusher

The FRONT_URL environment variable is used to verify the CORS domains allowed to access the API.
We are here explicitly allowing the "*" value to allow ALL domains to make a request on the pusher.
Use with care (will be used to allow custom domains in production)

Merge pull request #2199 from thecodingmachine/allow_star_url

Allowing "*" as a valid value for FRONT_URL in pusher

Improve docker compose self-hosted (#2201)

* Improve docker compose self-hosted

The problem is when it's first time that the project is installed, the folder component with all files generated doesn't exist and there are some problems into the front service container (svelte-check command errors) during dev building.

Signed-off-by: Gregoire Parant <g.parant@thecodingmachine.com>

Allowing pusher to forward redirect calls

For some reason, the /map endpoint was not more allowed to forward "redirect" calls coming from the admin API.
This commit fixes this issue.

Merge pull request #2203 from thecodingmachine/fix_redirect_map

Allowing pusher to forward redirect calls

Add console log to analyse connection lost error

Signed-off-by: Gregoire Parant <g.parant@thecodingmachine.com>
Translating in-game "room not allowed" message
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:thecodingmachine/workadventure into develop
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into xmpp
Fix unique nickname

issue.title: Connection lost after about one hour
issue.body:
Hi WA community,

I deployed an instance in my docker swarm cluster and it is working fine for about one hour.
After that, every body have a "Connection lost, reconnect..."
No errors or warnings in the browser console, nether in the server side services.
Restarting the pusher solve the issue.
Memory limit set to 4G for pusher and back, 2G for otherones.

Attached the docker swarm docker-compose.yml I used (I have a federated Traefik instance in the cluster).

Using last release v1.8.4.

Thanks for your help.

[docker-compose-env.txt](https://github.com/thecodingmachine/workadventure/files/8213725/docker-compose-env.txt)

comment.body:
I saw that it is due to a timeout on the network routing mesh of docker swarm that close the open socket after a delay of inactivity.
I solved this by adding this config into the deploy config of the back service:  `endpoint_mode: dnsrr`
Doc here: https://docs.docker.com/network/overlay/#bypass-the-routing-mesh-for-a-swarm-service


```yaml
  back:
    image: thecodingmachine/workadventure-back:$BASE_TAG
    environment:
      - SECRET_JITSI_KEY=
      - SECRET_KEY=secret
      - ADMIN_API_TOKEN=token
      - ADMIN_API_URL=
      - TURN_SERVER=
      - TURN_USER=
      - TURN_PASSWORD=
      - TURN_STATIC_AUTH_SECRET=
      - STUN_SERVER=stun:stun.ippi.fr:3478
      - JITSI_URL=meet.jit.si
      - JITSI_ISS=
      - MAX_PER_GROUP=12
      - STORE_VARIABLES_FOR_LOCAL_MAPS=true
      - ALLOW_ARTILLERY=true
    networks:
      - "default"
    deploy:
      replicas: 1
      endpoint_mode: dnsrr
      resources:
        limits:
          cpus: '2.00'
          memory: 2G
      placement:
        constraints:
        - 'node.role == worker'
      update_config:
        parallelism: 1
        delay: 10s
```

issue.title: Possible to be not silent in a silent zone
issue.body:
This one is a bit tricky to reproduce.

Go next to a silent zone.
Run in it, but try to stop at the entrance of the silent zone.
If you manage to have your Woka to stop at the very frame when it enters the zone, you will see your Woka inside the zone, but the silent zone will not be triggered.

This is probably easier to reproduce on a slow machine.

commits.message:
Bump ejs from 3.1.6 to 3.1.7 in /desktop/electron (#2145)

Bumps [ejs](https://github.com/mde/ejs) from 3.1.6 to 3.1.7.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/mde/ejs/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/mde/ejs/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/mde/ejs/compare/v3.1.6...v3.1.7)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: ejs
  dependency-type: indirect
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Co-authored-by: dependabot[bot] <49699333+dependabot[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
unsubscribe from availabilityStatusStore (#2185)
Fix nes-container border on chrome
Remove .htaccess as it's no longer in use

Fixing camera led always on

This commit fixes a race condition in the "getUserMedia" call that could lead to the webcam being in an always on state.

If we open and close the webcam really quickly, the camera close was sometimes passing BEFORE the open was fully resolved (because getUserMedia can take a few 100ms to answer properly).
As a result, the webcam would stay open.
To solve this, we are putting all calls to getUserMedia in a resolve chain (`currentGetUserMediaPromise`)

Closes #2149
Update all docker nodejs container to the last LTS (16)

Adding required HTTP authentication to access /metrics endpoint

This commit adds an HTTP authentication endpoint on the back component.
HTTP Bearer Authentication is now REQUIRED. If the PROMETHEUS_AUTHORIZATION_TOKEN environment variable is not set (to configure the authentication token), the /metrics endpoint is disabled.
Adding PROMETHEUS_AUTHORIZATION_TOKEN in template environment variables
Addng PROMETHEUS_AUTHORIZATION_TOKEN to the pusher. Now, the /metrics endpoint of the pusher must be accessed with a Bearer auth token too.
make sure we subscribe to stores after estabilishing connection
availabilityStatus info from websocket
fix PlayerStore wrong availabilityStatus name
make sure the user we try to get inside the group is not silent
remove now obsolete console.log
Adding a map to test startup on silent zone

Select first Woka (#2180)

* Select first Woka

 - Select the first Woka in the scene

Signed-off-by: Gregoire Parant <g.parant@thecodingmachine.com>

Improving typings

This PR solves a number of issues (but not all) found when enabling the rule ESLint rule "@typescript-eslint/no-unsafe-call" in the front.
Fix uiWebsite updating
Add joystick & click to move on disable controls
Fix deny proximity meeting
Translating in-game "room not allowed" message

issue.title: Feature Request: multi-architecture build structure (linux/amd64 and linux/arm64)
issue.body:
# Leverage architecture on build process

As Apple Silicon (ARM64/v8) becomes more ubiquitous, and companies like Amazon have instances that are cheaper using the ARM architecture, an ARM64 build of this image is very interesting to have.

As a now Mac / Linux user, I feel the performance loss of not using native ARM packages when running containers from this project.

Also: Tini misbehaves when using the AMD64 platform version on Apple Silicon.

Currently, the only architecture on thecodingmachine's Docker Hub repository is amd64

Sury (The Debian repository we get packages for PHP) has ARM64 packages. I've tested building it.

I'm working on a version of the build scripts that leverage the architecture being built to select packages like tini and supercronic for the proper architecture.

I'll update this issue as I get deeper into this.

comment.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6232674/168934816-b0090bfe-f68a-47b2-aa14-4dabb15e8b01.png)
I managed to pass the entire process on a Mac. I had to comment out some tests that misbehave in terms of permissions on a Mac. Probably because of filesystem differences.

Now that I know the images are build-able, I'll get back to my Linux x64 machine and run the build process with all the tests with ARM64 emulation.

It was taking forever to build on an emulation layer, so debugging was a pain.

I'll update this issue as I get deeper into this.
